intro: Descurainia richardsonii subsp. typica, commonly known as Richardson's tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has small, pinnately divided leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and plant identification in arid regions.
